column4: hey guys, im going away for a while and i want to setup this box so i cant ssh to it and use it. How do i do that?
remove sshd :)
im a bit of a noob when it comes to this kind of thing...how do i go about configuring my system so i can do that?
sudo aptitude install openssh-server
if your box is behind a router, make sure portforwarding to port22 (default) is set up
ok thanks, it's installing now...can i get you to ssh to it to check if it's working? (or tell me how i check itmyself)
better check yourself, ssh -l user host
never give anyone you don't know ssh-access to your boxes
but will that let me check whether or not that router thingy is blocking something?
do i have to do anything else once ive installed open-ssh  or will everything just 'work' ? :)
user external IP for testing, needs nat-loopback enabled in router
default sshd-config  should be fine for 1st tests
ok the aptitutde install is complete. what's next? :)
sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start
better check yourself, ssh -l user your-external-host-ip
ok, cool it seems to work. :) But my system at the other system is windows, what's the best way to connect to it from windows?
use putty, windows ssh-client
cool. So so long as i dont restart my computer now, i will be able to connect to it from my other windows system?
even after reboot you should be able to. sshd should be startet at boottime
that's cool. Is it safe to have the server running all the time though? can't someone hack it
ssh is pretty safe, but make sure to use keys for authentication or at least good paswords
pass
ilovemon isn't a good one :)
